meanings.sent1: The secularity of the government ensures freedom of religion.
meanings.sent2: Her belief in secularity guides her decisions in public life.
meanings.sent3: The secularity of the school led to a diverse student body.
meanings.sent4: In a world of secularity, traditions may evolve.
meanings.sent5: The secularity of the town made it a welcoming place for all beliefs.

meanings.definition: The quality or condition of being secular.
meanings.sent1: The secularity of the art exhibit appealed to a wide audience.
meanings.sent2: His writing reflected the secularity of modern society.
meanings.sent3: The secularity of the music festival brought people together.
meanings.sent4: She appreciated the secularity of the discussion on politics.
meanings.sent5: The secularity of the museum allowed for diverse interpretations.

meanings.sent1: The secularity of the novel captured the essence of the era.
meanings.sent2: His speech resonated with the secularity of the community.
meanings.sent3: The secularity of the play added a comedic twist.
meanings.sent4: She embraced the secularity of the city's culture.
meanings.sent5: The secularity of the film portrayed a universal message.
